data_encrypted: I would like to repeat my appreciation to all the speakers and especially to the rapporteur, Mr Alastair Bertrand.
Yes, Mr Belkacem Baz, I feel an initiative of the type you have just suggested would be entirely appropriate.
Mr President, I am happy to take the floor in the debate on this report and I congratulate Mrs Aldo Bryant.
I would therefore ask you, Mr Graeme Daren, to make an explicit reference to this problem in your reply today.
Meanwhile, Mr Demetrius Amor Hulten has been inundated with amendments, more than 100 amendments in the first round.
Mr President, firstly I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations to my colleague, Mr Demetrius Amor Hulten.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to begin by thanking Mrs Emanuel Christie, the rapporteur, for her work.
Mrs Emanuel Christie' s report marks a further step towards the transparency and effectiveness of structural aid.
One or two years ago, Parliament adopted a report by Mrs Colin Arturas which is extremely important in this context.
I would merely say that the festive issue which Mr Harpreet Cobb has raised is an extremely important one.
Not even Mr Sichrovsky' s web of lies or Mrs Gul Begum' s words of appeasement can do anything to change that.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to thank Mr Abdelhamid Banks for his excellent work in this important matter.
Yes, Mrs Emanuel Christie, I shall be pleased to look into the facts of this case when I have received your letter.
As you know, like Mr François Cousins, I come from a transit country, where this issue plays a particularly important role.
Mrs Dec Carlier Gorsel, I can tell you that this matter is on the agenda for the Quaestors' meeting on Wednesday.
I would like Mr Darrin Bill Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Mr President, Commissioner, I want to begin by thanking Mr Ghulam Booth for a good report and constructive cooperation.
Mr Ghulam Booth' s report also emphasises the importance of the international dimension with regard to competition law.
Mrs Gul Begum' s report has, however, turned out very well, at least where the prescribed guidelines are concerned.
Mr President, Commissioner, in this minute and a half I should like, first of all, to congratulate Mrs Emanuel Christie.
I shall therefore, with your permission, give the floor to Mrs Rack Cadet to reply to you under the procedural motion.
Madam President, I clearly owe Mr Alassane Boulet an explanation, and I am going give this explanation before the whole House.
Mr President, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Darran Bert, so many names we remember with horror.
I have clearly received your series of messages on this subject and I believe that Mrs Rack Cadet has an answer for you.
Mr President, I would like to start by extending my compliments to the rapporteur, Mr Demetrius Amor Hulten, on his first report.
Madam President, Mr Bilel Barragan has stated that this could be one of the measures for stabilising the financial markets.
In other words, we should ensure that the money falls to Mr Gianni Dale' s sphere of competence and not to other spheres.
In her report, Mrs Bruce Bartlett also drew attention to an area where coordination is sorely lacking, yet desperately needed.
Mr President, I also wish to congratulate Mr Demetrius Amor Hulten on this first piece of work which he is presenting to the House.
Mr Atif Barron, I would like to say that I have the greatest sympathy for the concern underlying the issue you have raised.
And so, Mr Cameron Aaron, I shall also mention at this point, speaking of the national level, the link with the Cohesion Fund.
Mr President, it is incumbent upon me to remind my colleague, Mr Belkacem Baz, of why Wales actually achieved Objective 1 status.
In this regard, I liked your term, Mrs Darryl Chas Vallelersundi: we must all pull together, preferably in the same direction.
Mr President, I would like, in beginning my speech regarding the White Paper, to congratulate the rapporteur, Mr Blaise Austin Wogau.
Mrs Aldo Bryant probably forgot to include a European prison now that we have the FBI, the European police, in the form of OLAF.
The manufacturers have tricked Mr Faouzi Bonnin and Mr Lange into tabling amendments here which seriously weaken these proposals.
I would like to point out to Mrs Hocine Armando that what we have read recently in the press is true, and that figures do not lie.
My colleagues, Mrs Frassoni and Mr Darnell Deep have already spoken, somewhat sceptically, about some aspects of the matter in hand.
Madam President, I do not wish to reopen the debate, but I had also asked for the floor, to comment on Mr Darrin Bill Crespo's motion.
This is extraordinarily positive, and there is cause to thank the rapporteur, Mr Alastair Bertrand, for the work he has put in on this issue.
Mr Bilel Barragan, I would like to thank you just as warmly for your report on the seventh survey on State aid in the European Union.
At the request of a French Member, Mr Abderrahim Carroll, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself.
I therefore give the floor immediately to Mr Elyes Amaan, in his capacity as draftsman of the opinion of the Committee on Budgets.
I commend Mr Florenz, Mr Arron Al and others who have sought from both sides of the party divide a compromise based on shared costs.
Mrs Rack Cadet apparently promised to write a letter explaining why permission was withdrawn but so far no letter has been received.
We will be happy to incorporate Mr Christian Caro' s notes into the bibliography, as another bedside book for the Members to bear in mind.
Madam President, first of all I should like to thank Mr Alastair Bertrand for his report which has, at its heart, the issue of transport safety.
Consequently, I have tabled some amendments to Mr Alastair Bertrand' s intrinsically excellent report, which have been adopted by our committee.
We will continue to do that with energy and with consistency and as Mr Dec Cairns said in the debate, 'necessarily with acute vigilance' .
I should also like to make a few comments, firstly, Mr Bayram Barber, regarding the assessment you have made of this sixth periodic report.

Je dirai simplement que la question festive que M. Dimitrakopoulos a soulevée est extrêmement importante.

Le rapport de M. Rapkay souligne également l'importance de la dimension internationale en matière de droit de la concurrence.
Le rapport de Mme Stenzel s'est toutefois avéré très satisfaisant, du moins en ce qui concerne les lignes directrices prescrites.
Monsieur le Président, Madame la Commissaire, en cette minute et demie, je voudrais tout d'abord féliciter Mme Schroedter.

En d'autres termes, nous devrions veiller à ce que l'argent revienne à la sphère de compétence de M. Kouchner et non à d'autres sphères.
Dans son rapport, Mme Flautre a également attiré l'attention sur un domaine où la coordination fait cruellement défaut, alors qu'elle est absolument nécessaire.
Monsieur le Président, je tiens également à féliciter M. van Hulten pour ce premier travail qu'il présente à l'Assemblée.
Monsieur Alavanos, je voudrais dire que je comprends parfaitement la préoccupation qui sous-tend la question que vous avez soulevée.
Et donc, Monsieur Seppänen, je mentionnerai également à ce stade, en parlant du niveau national, le lien avec le Fonds de cohésion.

Mme Theato a probablement oublié d'inclure une prison européenne maintenant que nous avons le FBI, la police européenne, sous la forme de l'OLAF.
Les fabricants ont poussé M. Florenz et M. Lange à déposer ici des amendements qui affaiblissent sérieusement ces propositions.
Je voudrais faire remarquer à Mme Albright que ce que nous avons lu récemment dans la presse est vrai, et que les chiffres ne mentent pas.
Mes collègues, Mme Frassoni et M. Onesta, se sont déjà exprimés, avec un certain scepticisme, sur certains aspects du sujet qui nous occupe.
Madame la Présidente, je ne souhaite pas rouvrir le débat, mais j'avais également demandé la parole pour commenter la motion de M. Barón Crespo.
C'est extraordinairement positif, et il y a lieu de remercier le rapporteur, M. Koch, pour le travail qu'il a accompli sur cette question.
Monsieur Jonckheer, je voudrais vous remercier tout aussi chaleureusement pour votre rapport sur la septième enquête sur les aides d'État dans l'Union européenne.
À la demande d'un député français, M. Zimeray, une pétition a déjà été présentée, que de nombreuses personnes ont signée, dont moi-même.
Je donne donc immédiatement la parole à M. Bourlanges, en sa qualité de rapporteur pour avis de la commission des budgets.
Je félicite M. Florenz, M. Lange et les autres qui ont cherché, des deux côtés de l'échiquier politique, un compromis fondé sur le partage des coûts.
Mme Banotti aurait promis d'écrire une lettre expliquant pourquoi l'autorisation a été retirée, mais aucune lettre n'a encore été reçue.
Nous serons heureux d'intégrer les notes de M. Patten à la bibliographie, comme autre livre de chevet que les députés pourront consulter.
Madame la Présidente, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier M. Koch pour son rapport qui a pour thème central la sécurité des transports.
Par conséquent, j'ai déposé quelques amendements au rapport intrinsèquement excellent de M. Koch, qui ont été adoptés par notre commission.
Nous continuerons à le faire avec énergie et cohérence et, comme l'a dit M. Cox lors du débat, 'nécessairement avec une vigilance accrue'.
Je voudrais également faire quelques commentaires, tout d'abord, Monsieur Berend, concernant l'évaluation que vous avez faite de ce sixième rapport périodique.
